result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Louis Lang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Domestic Abuse and Anger Management.  DE has 3 days jail credit if probation revoked.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Louis Lang in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Christopher Louis Lang in custody.  Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Parties rec/rev revocation summary and recs.  Atty Frank is in agreement.  State states recommendations.  Atty Frank is in agreement and makes brief statement on behalf of his client.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Cts 2 and 3:  Probation revoked
Ct 2:  7 months jail w/huber concurrent to Ct 3 but consecutive to any other sentence
115 days sentence credit to be applied excluding today's date
Ct 3:  90 days jail w/huber concurrent to Ct 2 but consecutive to any other sentence
Any unpaid fines to be converted to civil judgments
DE may serve sentences in Racine Co if accepted
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher Louis Lang in court, in custody, w/o counsel.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not want an atty.  DE waives right to atty.   Court advises right to atty.  DE wishes to proceed w/o counsel.  Both parties recv'd and reviewed revocation summary.  State inquired w/DE about atty.  Court explains DE needs to contact Sauk Co. PD's office for appointment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher Louis Lang in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nagel states matter is resolved and states recs.  State agrees.  Guilty pleas entered by Atty Nagel.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Nagel makes statement.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 2:  Guilty
Ct 3:  Guilty
24 months probation on each concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
30 days jail w/huber but w/o good time on Ct 3 only
May serve in Racine Co if accepted
EMP approved
To commence on or before 11/1/2014 at 7:00 pm
Costs/surcharges of $443.00 x 2 to be paid per agent during term of probation
Domestic abuse/Anger management counseling and any other treatment/evaluations per agent
3 days sentence credit only if probation is revoked
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Louis Lang in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nagel states matter may be resolved but requests prelim.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Return date on September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher Louis Lang in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer has been extended, however matter is not yet resolved.  Request more time to review documents.  Request reset of return. Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on August 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Return date on August 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher Louis Lang appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State request cash bond with conditions.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Defendant is employed.  No history of bail jumping.  Defendant does not qualify.  LIkely to hire private counsel. Time limits waived. $1,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with S.H., her premises or her children.  Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.  No possession of weapons in public.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
